data.title: Snap Inc SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Snap Inc., a leading technology company known for its flagship product Snapchat, has released its annual Form 10-K report, detailing its financial and operational performance for the fiscal year. The report highlights significant improvements in revenue, a reduction in net loss, and strategic initiatives focused on augmented reality and community engagement.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $5,361 million, reflecting a 16% increase year-over-year driven by an increase in global advertising impressions volume.
  • Cost of Revenue: $2,474 million, representing a 17% increase primarily due to higher infrastructure costs associated with DAU growth and investments in machine learning and AI.
  • Operating Loss: $(787) million, an improvement from the previous year's loss of $(1,398) million, attributed to increased revenue and reduced research and development expenses.
  • Net Loss: $(698) million, a significant reduction from the prior year's net loss of $(1,322) million, primarily due to increased revenue and cost management.
  • Net Loss Per Share: $(0.42), compared to $(0.82) in the previous year, indicating improved financial performance.

Business Highlights

  • Business Overview: Snap Inc. is a technology company focused on improving communication through its flagship product, Snapchat, a visual messaging application. The company emphasizes augmented reality (AR) experiences and visual messaging as key components of its platform.
  • Product Segments: Snapchat consists of five distinct tabs: Camera, Visual Messaging, Snap Map, Stories, and Spotlight. Each tab offers unique features such as AR Lenses, personalized maps, and curated content, enhancing user engagement and interaction.
  • Augmented Reality (AR) Focus: Snap Inc. is heavily investing in AR technology, offering millions of AR Lenses and developing Spectacles, wearable AR glasses, to extend AR experiences beyond the Snapchat app.
  • Partner Ecosystem: The company collaborates with developers, creators, publishers, and advertisers to enhance Snapchat's features and content. This ecosystem supports diverse content creation and monetization opportunities.
  • Advertising Products: Snap Inc. offers a range of advertising products, including AR Ads and Snap Ads, which leverage the platform's visual and interactive capabilities to engage users and provide value to advertisers.
  • Geographical Performance: The company reports user engagement and growth across different regions, with specific mention of North America, Europe, and the Rest of the World, highlighting varying growth rates and market characteristics.
  • User Metrics: Daily Active Users (DAUs) increased by 9% year-over-year, reaching 453 million in Q4 2024, indicating strong user engagement and platform growth.
  • Future Outlook: Snap Inc. is focused on growing its community, diversifying revenue streams, and investing in the future of augmented reality. The company aims to navigate macroeconomic challenges by prioritizing investments and enhancing user engagement.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Strategic Reprioritization: The company has undertaken a strategic reprioritization to focus on three key areas: growing its community and deepening engagement, accelerating and diversifying revenue growth, and investing in augmented reality. This includes changes to the advertising platform to enhance delivery and measurement capabilities, despite facing challenges from macroeconomic factors and increased competition.
  • Capital Management: The company issued $750 million in convertible senior notes due in 2030, with net proceeds of $671.5 million. It also repurchased $859 million of convertible notes and authorized a $500 million stock repurchase program, although no shares were repurchased under this program in the fourth quarter of 2024. Additionally, the company has a $1.05 billion revolving credit facility to support working capital and general corporate purposes.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue its strategic focus on augmented reality and community engagement while managing macroeconomic challenges. It aims to maintain a strong liquidity position with $3.4 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities, and will explore merger and acquisition opportunities that align with its strategic priorities. The company also anticipates ongoing competition in the advertising space, which may impact revenue growth.

Challenges and Risks

  • User Engagement and Growth: The company faces significant challenges related to user engagement and growth, as its daily active user (DAU) growth rate has declined in the past and may continue to do so. This is compounded by competition for user attention and the need to penetrate older demographics or developing markets, which may be more difficult and costly.
  • Advertising Revenue: The company generates the majority of its revenue from advertising, which is subject to fluctuations based on advertisers' perceptions of the effectiveness of its platform. Changes in data privacy regulations, such as those implemented by Apple and potentially by Google, have already impacted the company's ability to target and measure advertisements effectively, leading to reduced demand and pricing for advertising products.
  • Operational Dependencies: Operationally, the company relies heavily on Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services for its computing needs. Any disruption or unfavorable changes in terms by these providers could seriously harm operations. The company also faces risks related to intellectual property protection, as it relies on various legal protections that may not be enforceable in all jurisdictions.
  • Governance Risks: The co-founders' control over voting stock presents governance risks, as they can influence major decisions, potentially against the interests of other shareholders. Macroeconomic uncertainties, including inflation, supply chain disruptions, and geopolitical conflicts, could adversely impact advertising revenue and operational stability.
  • Cybersecurity Risks: The company is also exposed to cybersecurity risks, as it collects and processes sensitive information. Any breach or failure to protect this data could damage its reputation and lead to legal and regulatory consequences.
  • Management's Discussion and Analysis: Management acknowledges the challenges posed by declining user growth and increased competition. The company is focusing on product innovation and diversification of revenue streams, such as subscription models, to mitigate these risks. However, the success of these initiatives is uncertain, and the company may face increased costs and regulatory scrutiny.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks, including fluctuations in advertising demand and pricing, which are influenced by broader economic conditions and changes in data privacy regulations. The reliance on third-party cloud services also presents operational risks that could impact financial performance if service disruptions occur.

SEC Filing: Snap Inc [ SNAP ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: OMNICOM GROUP INC. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Omnicom Group Inc., a leading global marketing and corporate communications company, has released its 2024 Form 10-K report, showcasing robust financial growth, strategic initiatives, and a forward-looking approach to business operations. The report highlights the company's performance across various segments, geographical regions, and outlines the strategic direction for future growth, including a significant merger with IPG.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $15,689.1 million, reflecting a 6.8% increase from the previous year, driven by organic growth and acquisitions.
  • Operating Income: $2,274.6 million, an increase of 8.1% from the prior year, with an operating margin of 14.5%.
  • Net Income - Omnicom Group Inc.: $1,480.6 million, up by $89.2 million year-over-year, influenced by increased revenue and operational efficiencies.
  • Net Income Per Share - Omnicom Group Inc.: Diluted: $7.46, an increase of 8.0% from the previous year, supported by share repurchases and improved earnings.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company operates in several key disciplines, including Media & Advertising, Precision Marketing, Public Relations, Healthcare, Branding & Retail Commerce, Experiential, and Execution & Support. Media & Advertising is the largest segment, accounting for 54% of revenue in 2024.
  • Geographical Performance: North America showed strong performance with a 6.3% organic revenue growth, driven by Media & Advertising and Precision Marketing. Latin America experienced a 17.2% organic growth, led by Media & Advertising. Europe saw a 2.7% organic growth, with notable performance in Media & Advertising and Experiential disciplines.
  • Geographical Performance: In Asia-Pacific, organic revenue increased, particularly in China, India, Australia, the Philippines, and Thailand, despite currency challenges. The Middle East and Africa also saw growth in Media & Advertising and Experiential disciplines.
  • New Product Launches: The company announced the formation of Omnicom Advertising Group (OAG) in August 2024, a new global organization that aligns creative networks BBDO, DDB, and TBWA, which began operations in January 2025.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates that the merger with IPG, if completed, will have a material impact on business operations, results, and financial condition. The merger is expected to enhance the company's market position and service offerings.
  • Future Outlook: The company is focusing on leveraging generative AI to enhance service delivery and productivity, while being mindful of associated risks and privacy concerns. This is expected to significantly impact operations in the future.
  • Operational Strategy: The company continues to pursue a client-centric business model, organizing services around client needs and expanding service offerings through acquisitions and collaborations across its networks.
  • Operational Strategy: The company is committed to environmental sustainability, with initiatives focusing on emissions reductions and efficiency improvements, aligning with the UN Global Compact and Sustainable Development Goals.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Merger Agreement: The company entered into a Merger Agreement with IPG on December 8, 2024, which is expected to have a material impact on its business, results of operations, and financial condition.
  • Acquisitions: The company acquired Flywheel Digital in January 2024 for approximately $845 million to enhance its digital commerce capabilities.
  • New Organization: The company announced the formation of Omnicom Advertising Group, a new global organization to align its creative networks and agencies.
  • Capital Management: The company issued €600 million 3.70% Senior Notes due 2032 and $600 million 5.30% Senior Notes due 2034 to fund general corporate purposes, including acquisitions and stock repurchases. It repaid $750 million 3.65% Senior Notes on November 1, 2024. The company also repurchased $268.6 million of its common stock, net of proceeds from stock plans, and paid $552.7 million in dividends to common shareholders. The company maintains a $2.5 billion unsecured multi-currency revolving credit facility and has the ability to issue up to $2 billion of U.S. Dollar denominated commercial paper.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue its strategic acquisition strategy, focusing on companies with strong entrepreneurial management teams to fill service delivery gaps. It also aims to leverage generative AI to enhance service delivery and productivity. The company expects foreign exchange rates to reduce revenue by 2.0% to 2.5% in the first quarter of 2025 and by 2.0% for the full year. The proposed merger with IPG is anticipated to significantly impact the company's strategic direction and financial performance.

Challenges and Risks

  • Merger Risks: The company is undergoing a significant merger with IPG, which introduces several risks including potential disruptions in business relationships, integration challenges, and the need for regulatory approvals. The merger is expected to have a material impact on the business, results of operations, and financial condition.
  • Economic Risks: The company faces risks from adverse economic conditions, including inflation, geopolitical events, and disruptions in credit markets, which could lead to reduced client spending and impact revenue.
  • Operational Risks: The company operates in a highly competitive industry and must remain competitive to retain key clients. The loss of major clients could significantly impact revenue.
  • Cybersecurity Risks: The company relies heavily on IT systems and faces evolving cybersecurity threats that could compromise data integrity and lead to financial and reputational damage.
  • AI Risks: The use of generative AI presents risks related to ethical considerations, regulatory compliance, and public perception, which could impact business operations.
  • International Risks: Currency exchange rate fluctuations and operations in high-growth markets pose risks due to economic and political uncertainties.
  • Regulatory Risks: Compliance with evolving data privacy laws and environmental, social, and governance expectations could lead to increased costs and liabilities.
  • Management Strategies: The company is closely monitoring global economic disruptions and client revenue levels to align its cost structure with changes in demand. The merger with IPG is expected to significantly impact the company's operations, and management is focused on realizing cost savings and synergies from the merger.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks, including foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, which could impact financial results. The company operates in over 50 currencies, and adverse fluctuations could affect revenue and profitability.

SEC Filing: OMNICOM GROUP INC. [ OMC ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: Alphabet Inc. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Alphabet Inc., the parent company of Google, has released its 2024 10-K report, showcasing a year of robust financial performance, significant business advancements, and strategic investments. The report highlights Alphabet's continued growth in its core services, cloud infrastructure, and AI integration, while also addressing the challenges and risks faced in a rapidly evolving technology landscape.

Financial Highlights

Alphabet Inc. reported strong financial results for 2024, driven by growth across its key business segments:

  • Total Revenues: $350,018 million, an increase of 14% year over year, primarily driven by an increase in Google Services revenues of $32.4 billion, or 12%, and an increase in Google Cloud revenues of $10.1 billion, or 31%.
  • Cost of Revenues: $146,306 million, an increase of 10% year over year, primarily driven by increases in content acquisition costs, TAC, and depreciation expense.
  • Operating Income: $112,390 million, an increase of 33% year over year, with an operating margin of 32%, up from 27% in the previous year.
  • Net Income: $100,118 million, an increase of 36% year over year, reflecting strong performance across Google Services and Google Cloud.
  • Diluted EPS: $8.04, an increase of 39% year over year, indicating improved profitability and efficiency.

Business Highlights

Alphabet Inc. made significant strides in its business operations, focusing on AI integration, cloud growth, and product innovation:

  • AI Integration: Google has integrated its Gemini AI model across all seven of its two billion-user products, including Android, Chrome, Gmail, Maps, Play Store, Search, and YouTube, enhancing user experience with advanced AI capabilities.
  • Google Cloud Growth: Google Cloud has seen significant growth, driven by its AI-optimized infrastructure and services, including the Vertex AI platform and Gemini for Google Cloud, which support enterprise innovation and cybersecurity.
  • Product Innovation: Google continues to innovate with new AI features such as AI Overviews and NotebookLM, which enhance user interaction by providing complex information breakdowns and summarizing sources.
  • Device Enhancements: The latest Pixel devices incorporate Gemini Nano, offering advanced AI-assistive experiences, and the Android and Chrome operating systems now include integrated AI features.
  • Moonshot Projects: Alphabet's Other Bets, including Waymo's autonomous driving technology, continue to develop, with Waymo now offering fully autonomous ride-hailing services in multiple cities.
  • Privacy and Security: Google prioritizes privacy and security by investing in secure-by-default products and responsible data practices, enhancing user control over their data.
  • Geographical Performance: The United States accounted for 49% of revenues in 2024, with EMEA at 29%, APAC at 16%, and Other Americas at 6%, reflecting a strong presence in the U.S. market.
  • Sustainability Goals: Alphabet aims to achieve net-zero emissions and 24/7 carbon-free energy by 2030, with significant investments in carbon removal solutions and renewable energy procurement.
  • Workforce and Culture: Alphabet had 183,323 employees as of December 31, 2024, emphasizing a collaborative and innovative work environment with industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities.
  • Future Outlook: Alphabet plans to continue investing in AI and technical infrastructure to support business growth and long-term initiatives, particularly in AI products and services.

Strategic Initiatives

Alphabet Inc. is focused on long-term growth through strategic investments and capital management:

  • Research and Development: Alphabet continues to invest heavily in research and development, particularly in AI and cloud services, to drive innovation and maintain competitive advantage.
  • Technical Infrastructure: The company is expanding its technical infrastructure, including servers and data centers, to support long-term growth and strategic initiatives.
  • Emerging Markets: Alphabet is investing in emerging markets to capitalize on the increasing online presence of users in these regions.
  • Capital Management: In 2024, Alphabet repurchased 379 million shares for $62.0 billion and declared dividends totaling $7.4 billion, marking the first time dividends were paid. The company also issued $13.6 billion in debt and repaid $12.7 billion, maintaining a strong liquidity position with $95.7 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities. Capital expenditures increased to $52.5 billion, primarily for technical infrastructure investments.
  • Future Outlook: Alphabet plans to increase investments in technical infrastructure to support AI products and services, indicating a focus on long-term growth. The company intends to continue its share repurchase program with $44.7 billion remaining authorized for future repurchases. Alphabet also plans to maintain its dividend payments, subject to board approval, and expects its existing liquidity to be sufficient to fund operations and capital commitments for the foreseeable future.

Challenges and Risks

Alphabet Inc. faces several challenges and risks in maintaining its competitive edge and ensuring sustainable growth:

  • Market Risks: The company generates a significant portion of its revenue from online advertising, which is sensitive to economic conditions and competition. Changes in advertising policies, data privacy practices, and technologies that block or impair ads could harm the business.
  • Operational Risks: Intense competition requires continuous innovation and investment in technical infrastructure and R&D. The expansion into AI and cloud services demands significant resources and poses risks related to the availability and pricing of third-party equipment and infrastructure.
  • Regulatory Risks: Alphabet is subject to a wide range of laws and regulations, including those related to data privacy, AI, and content moderation. New regulations, such as the EU AI Act and Digital Markets Act, could impose significant compliance costs and operational challenges.
  • Emerging Risks: The development and use of AI may lead to reputational harm and increased liability exposure due to issues like harmful content, inaccuracies, and data privacy concerns. The company must navigate evolving laws and regulations related to AI and data protection.
  • Supply Chain Risks: Alphabet relies on third-party manufacturers and suppliers, which exposes it to risks related to supply shortages, price increases, and quality issues. Geopolitical tensions and natural disasters could further disrupt the supply chain.
  • Foreign Currency Risks: Alphabet is exposed to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect its financial results. The company hedges a portion of its international currency exposure but remains vulnerable to significant exchange rate movements. Additionally, the fair value of investments may be impacted by market conditions, leading to potential volatility in financial performance.

SEC Filing: Alphabet Inc. [ GOOG ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: ARES CAPITAL CORP SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Ares Capital Corporation, a leading specialty finance company, has released its annual Form 10-K report, detailing its financial and operational performance for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024. The report highlights significant growth in investment income, strategic initiatives to enhance capital structure, and a robust outlook for future opportunities in the middle-market sector.

Financial Highlights

Total Investment Income: $2,990 million, reflecting an increase from the previous year primarily due to the increase in the average size of the portfolio.

Net Investment Income: $1,403 million, showing growth from the prior year, driven by higher interest income and capital structuring service fees.

Net Realized Losses on Investments: $(55) million, improved from the previous year's losses, with significant realized gains from certain portfolio companies.

Net Unrealized Gains on Investments: $188 million, indicating a positive change in the valuation of portfolio investments.

Net Increase in Stockholders’ Equity Resulting from Operations: $1,522 million, consistent with the previous year, highlighting stable operational performance.

Business Highlights

Business Model: Ares Capital Corporation operates as a specialty finance company, primarily investing in U.S. middle-market companies through debt and equity investments. The company focuses on generating current income and capital appreciation.

Investment Strategy: The company invests mainly in first lien senior secured loans, second lien senior secured loans, subordinated debt, and preferred equity. It targets middle-market companies with annual EBITDA between $10 million and $250 million.

Market Position: As of December 31, 2024, Ares Capital was the largest publicly traded business development company (BDC) by market capitalization, with approximately $28.3 billion in total assets.

Geographical Performance: The company's investment portfolio is diversified across various regions, with significant investments in the West (25.2%), Midwest (20.9%), and Southeast (19.3%) regions of the United States.

Industry Focus: Ares Capital's portfolio is diversified across industries, with major investments in Software and Services (24.5%), Health Care Equipment and Services (12.0%), and Financial Services (9.9%).

Operational Structure: The company is externally managed by Ares Capital Management LLC, leveraging the resources and relationships of Ares Management Corporation to identify and manage investment opportunities.

Competitive Advantages: Ares Capital benefits from the Ares platform, which provides extensive deal flow, investment evaluation, and due diligence capabilities, along with a seasoned investment team and broad origination strategy.

Future Outlook: The company anticipates continued opportunities in the middle-market sector due to reduced competition from traditional banks and a large pool of un-invested private equity capital seeking debt financing.

Regulatory Structure: Ares Capital is regulated as a BDC under the Investment Company Act and has elected to be treated as a regulated investment company (RIC) under the Internal Revenue Code, which influences its investment and operational strategies.

Strategic Initiatives

Strategic Initiatives: The company has focused on strategic initiatives such as the establishment of the Senior Direct Lending Program (SDLP) in partnership with Varagon to provide first lien senior secured loans to U.S. middle-market companies. Additionally, the company completed two significant debt securitizations, ADL CLO 1 and ADL CLO 4, to enhance its capital structure and support its lending activities.

Capital Management: The company engaged in several capital management activities, including issuing and selling 65.2 million shares of common stock through 'at the market' offerings, generating net proceeds of $1.36 billion. It also repaid the 2024 Convertible Notes and the June 2024 Notes upon their maturity. The company maintained a stock repurchase program with $1.0 billion available for repurchases, although no shares were repurchased during the year. The company also managed its debt portfolio by maintaining various credit facilities and issuing new notes, resulting in a total debt outstanding of $13.8 billion as of December 31, 2024.

Future Outlook: The company plans to continue leveraging its strategic partnerships and securitization capabilities to support its lending activities. It aims to maintain a strong balance sheet by managing its debt levels and exploring opportunities for further equity offerings. The company also intends to utilize its stock repurchase program strategically, depending on market conditions and liquidity requirements.

Challenges and Risks

Challenges and Risks: The company faces significant risks due to potential disruptions and instability in the capital markets, which could adversely affect its ability to raise debt and equity capital. Global economic, political, and market conditions, including geopolitical tensions and inflation, exacerbate these risks. The company's reliance on key personnel and systems from Ares, as well as its competitive market for investment opportunities, further compounds operational risks. Additionally, the company's investments in middle-market companies, which are often illiquid and highly leveraged, pose substantial risks, especially during economic downturns.

The company is also exposed to regulatory risks, including maintaining its status as a Business Development Company (BDC) and a Regulated Investment Company (RIC). Failure to comply with these regulations could significantly impact its operational flexibility and tax obligations. Furthermore, the company must navigate complex regulations regarding transactions with affiliates, which could limit investment opportunities.

Emerging risks include increased scrutiny and potential regulatory changes related to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) matters, which could impose additional costs and affect the company's reputation. The evolving landscape of artificial intelligence and its regulatory implications also present new challenges.

Management acknowledges the challenges posed by the current macroeconomic environment, including labor shortages, supply chain disruptions, and interest rate volatility. The company is focused on managing these risks through strategic investment decisions and maintaining a diversified portfolio to mitigate potential losses.

The company is subject to market risks, particularly interest rate fluctuations, which could impact its investment returns and net investment income. The use of leverage magnifies these risks, potentially leading to greater volatility in the company's financial performance. Additionally, the company faces risks related to the valuation of its investments, as most are not publicly traded and may be subject to significant unrealized depreciation during market downturns.

SEC Filing: ARES CAPITAL CORP [ ARCC ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: Visma Launches Compulsory Acquisition of Penneo Shares
data.description:
Visma Danmark Holding said Wednesday it is buying the remaining shares of Penneo through a compulsory acquisition at 16.5 Danish kroner apiece.

The remaining minority shareholders of the Danish software-as-a-service company have until March 5 to transfer their shares, with settlement scheduled later.

The last day of trading for Penneo shares on Nasdaq Copenhagen is also expected on the same day, subject to the delisting application's approval.

data.title: Market Chatter: Apple Could Face Antitrust Probe From China Over App Store Policies, Fees
data.description:
Apple may face an antitrust probe by China's State Administration for Market Regulation over Apple's App Store fees and practices, Bloomberg News reported Wednesday, citing sources with knowledge of the matter.

The review focuses on the US technology giant's policy of charging up to 30% commission on in-app purchases, as well as its ban on third-party payment methods and app stores, the report said.

SAMR officials have been in discussions with Apple executives and app developers since last year, amid long-running disputes with companies like Tencent and ByteDance, the report added.

An official investigation may be launched if Apple does not respond positively to the initial discussions, the report said.

SAMR, Apple, Tencent and ByteDance did not immediately respond to requests for comment from MT Newswires.

Shares of Apple were down about 2.7% in recent premarket activity.

(Market Chatter news is derived from conversations with market professionals globally. This information is believed to be from reliable sources but may include rumor and speculation. Accuracy is not guaranteed.)

data.title: Vestas reverses course to rise 5% as positive signals for future outweigh margin view
data.description:
** Shares in Vestas reverse course to rise 5% after falling around 3% earlier in the session, after the Danish wind turbine maker guided for a lower than expected 2025 profit

** Morningstar analyst Matthew Donen says investors are welcoming Q4 EBIT margin of 12.4%, which "comfortably surpassed expectations"

** Donen adds the 2025 adjusted EBIT margin guidance of 4-7% also appears "achievable", even though Jefferies notes it was around 130 bp below expectations at mid-point

** Sydbank Jacob Pedersen says Vestas expresses high confidence in the future – including the U.S. market

** Kepler Cheuvreux analyst William Mackie sees Vestas' narrative forming around a number of points that are price sensitive, such as service challenges behind, good growth outlook and margins on recovery

data.title: Luxembourg Inflation Rate Rises to 6-Month High
data.description:
The annual inflation rate in Luxembourg rose to 1.94% in January 2025 from 1% in December 2024.

This marked the highest reading since July, as prices accelerated for food and non-alcoholic beverages (0.59% vs 0.5% in December), transports (1.55% vs 0.95%), alcoholic beverages and tobacco (2.59% vs 2.48%), and hotels, cafes, and restaurants (3.08% vs 2.86%).

Moreover, prices rebounded sharply for housing and utilities (5.53% vs -1.84%).

Meanwhile, costs slowed for clothing and footwear (0.6% vs 1.23%), health (1.15% vs 1.18%), recreation and culture (1.27% vs 4.88%), and miscellaneous goods and services (0.87% vs 1.75%).

On a monthly basis, consumer prices edged higher to 0.4% in January 2025 from 0.1% in December 2024.

KOF: Swiss Business Situation Weakens in January
data.description:
The KOF Business Situation Indicator for the Swiss private sector declined in January, mainly driven by weakness in the manufacturing industry.

Based on the KOF Business Tendency Surveys published Wednesday, the index fell to 12.5 in January from 14.3 in the previous month. Companies also turned a little more cautious about business expectations over the next six months, according to the Swiss research institute.

data.title: Ares Management Total Assets Under Management $484.4B as of Dec. 31 >ARES
Ares Management Declares Qtrly Dividend of $1.12/Shr >ARES
Ares Management Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results
data.description:
Ares Management Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results

NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 05, 2025--

Ares Management Corporation today reported its financial results for its fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2024.

GAAP net income attributable to Ares Management Corporation was $177.3 million for the quarter ended December 31, 2024. On a basic and diluted basis, net income attributable to Ares Management Corporation per share of Class A and non-voting common stock was $0.72 for the quarter ended December 31, 2024.

After-tax realized income was $434.7 million for the quarter ended December 31, 2024. After-tax realized income per share of Class A common stock was $1.23 for the quarter ended December 31, 2024. Fee related earnings were $396.2 million for the quarter ended December 31, 2024.

"During 2024, we set many financial records, including our best year ever in gross fundraising and capital deployed. We raised $93 billion of new funds in 2024 and ended the year with $484 billion of AUM," said Michael Arougheti, Chief Executive Officer of Ares. "We continued to expand our investment platform, diversify our distribution channels across institutional, wealth and insurance and generate compelling investment performance for our investors. As we head into 2025, we are optimistic that we are entering into a more active transaction environment which should create more investment opportunities for our platform."

"With a record $95 billion of assets under management not yet paying fees, we are well positioned to invest opportunistically across a broad range of our strategies for investors and to drive continued strong growth in our key financial metrics over the next several years," said Jarrod Phillips, Chief Financial Officer of Ares. "We are making excellent progress on GCP International and we now expect the transaction will close in the first quarter. We believe the GCP International business we are acquiring is well positioned and we expect progress on a number of new fundraising initiatives this year."

Common Stock Dividend

Ares declared a quarterly dividend of $1.12 per share of its Class A and non-voting common stock, payable on March 31, 2025 to its Class A and non-voting common stockholders of record at the close of business on March 17, 2025.

Preferred Stock Dividend

Ares declared a quarterly dividend of $0.84375 per share of its 6.75% Series B mandatory convertible preferred stock, payable on April 1, 2025 to its preferred stockholders of record at the close of business on March 15, 2025.

Dividend Reinvestment Program

Ares has a Dividend Reinvestment Program for its Class A common stockholders that will be effective for the quarterly dividend on March 31, 2025. Equiniti Trust Company is engaged to administer the plan on behalf of Ares. Additional information can be located on the Investor Resources section of our website.

Additional Information

Ares issued a full detailed presentation of its fourth quarter and full year 2024 results, which can be viewed at www.aresmgmt.com on the Investor Resources section of our home page under Events and Presentations. The presentation is titled "Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Presentation."

2025 Annual Stockholders Meeting

The Board of Directors set April 7, 2025 as the record date for Ares' 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. The 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders will be held on June 6, 2025.

Conference Call and Webcast Information

Ares will host a conference call on February 5, 2025 at 10:00 a.m. (Eastern Time) to discuss fourth quarter and full year results. All interested parties are invited to participate via telephone or the live webcast, which will be hosted on a webcast link located on the Home page of the Investor Resources section of our website at http://www.aresmgmt.com. Please visit the website to test your connection before the webcast. Domestic callers can access the conference call by dialing +1 (800) 343-5172. International callers can access the conference call by dialing +1 (203) 518-9856. All callers are asked to dial in 10-15 minutes prior to the call so that name and company information can be collected and to reference the conference ID ARESQ424. For interested parties, an archived replay of the call will be available through March 5, 2025 to domestic callers by dialing +1 (800) 839-2475 and to international callers by dialing +1 (402) 220-7220. An archived replay will also be available through March 5, 2025 on a webcast link located on the Home page of the Investor Resources section of our website.

About Ares Management Corporation

Ares Management Corporation is a leading global alternative investment manager offering clients complementary primary and secondary investment solutions across the credit, real estate, private equity and infrastructure asset classes. We seek to provide flexible capital to support businesses and create value for our stakeholders and within our communities. By collaborating across our investment groups, we aim to generate consistent and attractive investment returns throughout market cycles. As of December 31, 2024, Ares Management Corporation's global platform had over $484 billion of assets under management, with operations across North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. For more information, please visit www.aresmgmt.com.

DIVIDEND DECLARATIONS

NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 05, 2025--

Ares Capital Corporation ("Ares Capital") announced that its Board of Directors has declared a first quarter 2025 dividend of $0.48 per share. The first quarter 2025 dividend is payable on March 31, 2025 to stockholders of record as of March 14, 2025.

DECEMBER 31, 2024 FINANCIAL RESULTS

Ares Capital also announced financial results for its fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2024.

"With our fourth quarter's results, we concluded another successful year for the company where stable credit performance and a record year of investing supported strong earnings and further growth in book value per share," said Kipp deVeer, Chief Executive Officer of Ares Capital. "As we enter 2025, we believe we are well positioned for what we expect will be an increasingly active investing market for acquisition finance and growth capital opportunities."

"Through year-end 2024, we have now paid over 15 consecutive years of stable or growing regular dividends while continuing to increase our book value for shareholders," said Scott Lem, Chief Financial Officer of Ares Capital. "Our ability to deliver this attractive level of long-term performance is supported by the strength of our balance sheet, which we believe is a key point of differentiation for ARCC."

In the fourth quarter of 2024, Ares Capital made new investment commitments of approximately $3.8 billion, of which approximately $2.8 billion were funded. New investment commitments included 26 new portfolio companies and 51 existing portfolio companies. As of December 31, 2024, 241 separate private equity sponsors were represented in Ares Capital's portfolio. Of the approximately $3.8 billion in new commitments made during the fourth quarter of 2024, 88% were in first lien senior secured loans, 2% were in subordinated certificates of the Senior Direct Lending Program (the "SDLP"), 1% were in senior subordinated loans, 3% were in Ares Capital's subordinated loan investment in IHAM and 6% were in other equity. Of the approximately $3.8 billion in new commitments, 94% were in floating rate debt securities, of which 87% contained interest rate floors and 2% were in the subordinated certificates of the SDLP. The weighted average yield of debt and other income producing securities funded during the period at amortized cost was 9.9% and the weighted average yield on total investments funded during the period at amortized cost was 9.2%. Ares Capital may seek to sell all or a portion of these new investment commitments, although there can be no assurance that Ares Capital will be able to do so. Also in the fourth quarter of 2024, Ares Capital funded approximately $441 million related to previously existing unfunded revolving and delayed draw loan commitments.

In the fourth quarter of 2024, Ares Capital exited approximately $2.7 billion of investment commitments, including approximately $458 million of loans sold to IHAM or certain vehicles managed by IHAM. Of the approximately $2.7 billion of exited investment commitments, 49% were first lien senior secured loans, 35% were second lien senior secured loans, 1% were subordinated certificates of the SDLP, 6% were senior subordinated loans, 5% were Ares Capital's subordinated loan investment in IHAM, 3% were preferred equity and 1% were other equity. Of the approximately $2.7 billion of exited investment commitments, 91% were floating rate, 5% were fixed rate, 1% were non-income producing and 3% were on non-accrual.

As of December 31, 2024 and 2023, the weighted average grade of the portfolio at fair value was 3.1 and 3.1, respectively, and loans on non-accrual status represented 1.7% of the total investments at amortized cost (or 1.0% at fair value) and 1.3% at amortized cost (or 0.6% at fair value), respectively. For more information on Ares Capital's portfolio investment grades and loans on non-accrual status, see "Part II--Item 7. Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations--Portfolio and Investment Activity" in Ares Capital's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2024, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") on February 5, 2025.

LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES

As of December 31, 2024, Ares Capital had $635 million in cash and cash equivalents and $13.8 billion in total aggregate principal amount of debt outstanding ($13.7 billion at carrying value). Subject to borrowing base and other restrictions, Ares Capital had approximately $5.1 billion available for additional borrowings under its existing credit facilities as of December 31, 2024.

In October 2024, Ares Capital and its consolidated subsidiary, Ares Capital CP Funding LLC ("Ares Capital CP"), entered into an agreement to amend Ares Capital CP's revolving funding facility (the "Revolving Funding Facility"). The amendment, among other things, (a) increased the commitments under the Revolving Funding Facility from approximately $1.8 billion to approximately $2.2 billion, (b) extended the end of the reinvestment period from December 29, 2024 to October 8, 2027, (c) extended the stated maturity date from December 29, 2026 to October 8, 2029 and (d) adjusted the interest rate charged on the Revolving Funding Facility from an applicable Secured Overnight Financing Rate ("SOFR") plus a credit spread adjustment of 0.10% or a "base rate" plus an applicable spread of 1.90% per annum to an applicable SOFR or a "base rate" (as defined in the documents governing the Revolving Funding Facility) plus an applicable spread of 2.00% per annum and with no credit spread adjustment. The other terms of the Revolving Funding Facility remained materially unchanged.

In November 2024, Ares Capital, through its wholly-owned, consolidated subsidiary, Ares Direct Lending CLO 4 LLC ("ADL CLO 4"), completed a $544 million term debt securitization (the "ADL CLO 4 Debt Securitization"). The ADL CLO 4 Debt Securitization is also known as a collateralized loan obligation and is an on-balance sheet financing incurred by Ares Capital, which is consolidated by Ares Capital for financial reporting purposes and subject to its overall asset coverage requirement. The loans incurred by the ADL CLO 4 Debt Securitization that mature on October 24, 2036 (collectively, the "October 2036 CLO Secured Loans") include (i) $464 million of Class A Senior Loans (the "October 2036 Class A CLO Loans") and (ii) $80 million of Class B Senior Loans (the "October 2036 Class B CLO Loans"). In addition, in connection with the ADL CLO 4 Debt Securitization, ADL CLO 4 issued approximately $260 million of subordinated notes (the "October 2036 CLO Subordinated Notes"). Ares Capital retained all of the October 2036 CLO Subordinated Notes, as such, the October 2036 CLO Subordinated Notes are eliminated in consolidation. The October 2036 Class A CLO Loans and the October 2036 Class B CLO Loans may be converted by the lender into notes issued by ADL CLO 4 and bearing the same economic terms, subject to certain conditions under the documents governing the October 2036 CLO Secured Loans and the indenture governing such notes.

In December 2024, Ares Capital and its consolidated subsidiary, Ares Capital JB Funding LLC ("ACJB LLC"), entered into an agreement to amend ACJB LLC's revolving funding facility (the "SMBC Funding Facility"). The amendment, among other things, (a) extended the end of the reinvestment period from March 28, 2027 to December 6, 2027, (b) extended the stated maturity date from March 28, 2029 to December 6, 2029 and (c) adjusted the interest rate charged on the SMBC Funding Facility from an applicable spread of either (i) 2.50% over one month SOFR or (ii) 1.50% over a "base rate" to an applicable spread of either (x) 2.00% over one month SOFR or (y) 1.00% over a "base rate" (as defined in the documents governing the SMBC Funding Facility). The other terms of the SMBC Funding Facility remained materially unchanged.

During the three months ended December 31, 2024, Ares Capital issued and sold approximately 24.6 million shares of common stock under its equity distribution agreements, with net proceeds totaling approximately $527.6 million, after giving effect to sales agents' commissions and certain estimated offering expenses.

FOURTH QUARTER 2024 DIVIDENDS PAID

On October 30, 2024, Ares Capital announced that its Board of Directors declared a fourth quarter 2024 dividend of $0.48 per share for a total of approximately $320 million. The fourth quarter 2024 dividend was paid on December 30, 2024 to stockholders of record as of December 13, 2024.

RECENT DEVELOPMENTS

In January 2025, Ares Capital issued $1.0 billion in aggregate principal amount of unsecured notes, which bear interest at a rate of 5.800% per annum and mature on March 8, 2032 (the "March 2032 Notes"). The March 2032 Notes pay interest semi-annually and all principal is due upon maturity. The March 2032 Notes may be redeemed in whole or in part at any time at Ares Capital's option at a redemption price equal to par plus a "make whole" premium, if applicable, as determined pursuant to the indenture governing the March 2032 Notes, and any accrued and unpaid interest. The March 2032 Notes were issued at a discount to the principal amount. In connection with the March 2032 Notes, Ares Capital entered into a forward-starting interest rate swap for a total notional amount of $1.0 billion that matures on March 8, 2032 with an effective date of January 8, 2026. Under the forward-starting interest rate swap, Ares Capital will receive a fixed interest rate of 5.800% and pay a floating interest rate of one-month SOFR plus 1.6995%.

In February 2025, Ares Capital's board of directors authorized an amendment to its existing stock repurchase program to extend the expiration date of the program from February 15, 2025 to February 15, 2026. Under the program, Ares Capital may repurchase up to $1.0 billion in the aggregate of its outstanding common stock in the open market at a price per share that meets certain thresholds below its net asset value per share, in accordance with the guidelines specified in Rule 10b-18 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. The timing, manner, price and amount of any share repurchases will be determined by Ares Capital, in its discretion, based upon the evaluation of economic and market conditions, stock price, applicable legal and regulatory requirements and other factors.

From January 1, 2025 through January 28, 2025, Ares Capital made new investment commitments of approximately $1.2 billion, of which approximately $864 million were funded. Of the approximately $1.2 billion in new investment commitments, 90% were in first lien senior secured loans, 1% were in second lien senior secured loans, 6% were in preferred equity and 3% were in other equity. Of the approximately $1.2 billion in new investment commitments, 79% were floating rate, 18% were fixed rate and 3% were non-income producing. The weighted average yield of debt and other income producing securities funded during the period at amortized cost was 10.1% and the weighted average yield on total investments funded during the period at amortized cost was 9.8%. Ares Capital may seek to sell all or a portion of these new investment commitments, although there can be no assurance that it will be able to do so.

From January 1, 2025 through January 28, 2025, Ares Capital exited approximately $498 million of investment commitments. Of the approximately $498 million of exited investment commitments, 69% were first lien senior secured loans, 11% were second lien senior secured loans, 11% were subordinated certificates of the SDLP, 7% were senior subordinated loans, 1% were preferred equity and 1% were other equity. Of the approximately $498 million of exited investment commitments, 80% were floating rate, 18% were fixed rate and 2% were non-income producing. The weighted average yield of debt and other income producing securities exited or repaid during the period at amortized cost was 10.8% and the weighted average yield on total investments exited or repaid during the period at amortized cost was 10.6%. Of the approximately $498 million of investment commitments exited from January 1, 2025 through January 28, 2025, Ares Capital recognized total net realized gains of approximately $1 million.

In addition, as of January 28, 2025, Ares Capital had an investment backlog of approximately $1.8 billion. Investment backlog includes transactions approved by Ares Capital's investment adviser's investment committee and/or for which a formal mandate, letter of intent or a signed commitment have been issued, and therefore Ares Capital believes are likely to close. The consummation of any of the investments in this backlog depends upon, among other things, one or more of the following: Ares Capital's acceptance of the terms and structure of such investment and the execution and delivery of satisfactory transaction documentation. In addition, Ares Capital may sell all or a portion of these investments and certain of these investments may result in the repayment of existing investments. Ares Capital cannot assure you that it will make any of these investments or that Ares Capital will sell all or any portion of these investments.

WEBCAST / CONFERENCE CALL

Ares Capital will host a webcast/conference call on Wednesday, February 5, 2025 at 12:00 p.m. (Eastern Time) to discuss its quarter and year ended December 31, 2024 financial results. PLEASE VISIT ARES CAPITAL'S WEBCAST LINK LOCATED ON THE HOME PAGE OF THE INVESTOR RESOURCES SECTION OF ARES CAPITAL'S WEBSITE FOR A SLIDE PRESENTATION THAT COMPLEMENTS THE EARNINGS CONFERENCE CALL.

All interested parties are invited to participate via telephone or the live webcast, which will be hosted on a webcast link located on the Home page of the Investor Resources section of Ares Capital's website at www.arescapitalcorp.com. Please visit the website to test your connection before the webcast. Domestic callers can access the conference call toll free by dialing +1 (800) 343-4849. International callers can access the conference call by dialing +1 (203) 518-9848. All callers are asked to dial in 10-15 minutes prior to the call so that name and company information can be collected and to reference the conference ID ARCCQ424. For interested parties, an archived replay of the call will be available approximately one hour after the end of the call through March 5, 2025 at 5:00 p.m. (Eastern Time) to domestic callers by dialing toll free +1 (800) 839-2457 and to international callers by dialing +1 (402) 220-7217. An archived replay will also be available through March 5, 2025 on a webcast link located on the Home page of the Investor Resources section of Ares Capital's website.

ABOUT ARES CAPITAL CORPORATION

Founded in 2004, Ares Capital is a leading specialty finance company focused on providing direct loans and other investments in private middle market companies in the United States. Ares Capital's objective is to source and invest in high-quality borrowers that need capital to achieve their business goals, which oftentimes can lead to economic growth and employment. Ares Capital believes its loans and other investments in these companies can help generate attractive levels of current income and potential capital appreciation for investors. Ares Capital, through its investment manager, utilizes its extensive, direct origination capabilities and incumbent borrower relationships to source and underwrite predominantly senior secured loans but also subordinated debt and equity investments. Ares Capital has elected to be regulated as a business development company ("BDC") and was the largest publicly traded BDC by market capitalization as of December 31, 2024. Ares Capital is externally managed by a subsidiary of Ares Management Corporation , a publicly traded, leading global alternative investment manager. For more information about Ares Capital, visit www.arescapitalcorp.com.

Sri Lanka shares end lower as IT, real estate drag
data.description:
Sri Lankan shares closed lower on Wednesday, dragged by information technology and real estate stocks.

* The CSE All-Share index (.CSE) settled 2.95% lower at 16,456.10.

* Sri Lanka said on Wednesday that cabinet approval has been given to finalise a debt restructuring deal with Japan, a move that follows a preliminary agreement reached last June with key bilateral lenders.

* "After multiple rounds of negotiations, this is an important step for Sri Lanka to complete its debt restructuring process and emerge from a severe financial crisis. This is an important step for Sri Lanka to rebuild its economy," Cabinet spokesperson Nalinda Jayatissa told reporters.

* Industrial Asphalts (Ceylon) Plc and Colombo Fort Land & Building Plc were the top losers on the index, down 20% and 15.5%, respectively.

* Trading volume on the index rose to 241.3 million shares from 121.9 million shares in the previous session.

* The equity market's turnover rose to 6.35 billion Sri Lankan rupees ($21.27 million) from 3.04 billion rupees in the previous session, according to exchange data.

* Foreign investors were net sellers, offloading stocks worth 469.3 million rupees, while domestic investors were net buyers, purchasing shares worth 6.23 billion rupees, the data showed.

* For a report on global markets, click

($1 = 298.6000 Sri Lankan rupees)

data.title: Market Chatter: UniCredit CEO Vows 'Softer' Integration With German Unit Amid Commerzbank Takeover Talks
data.description:
UniCredit (UCG.MI) Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel assured staff at its German unit that a "softer" integration would occur if the Italian lender pursues a takeover of Commerzbank , Bloomberg News reported Wednesday.

In an internal memo, Orcel said the potential combination would only affect UniCredit's HypoVereinsbank in the medium term, adding that its German business will continue "on its own trajectory."

UniCredit and Commerzbank did not immediately respond to requests for comment from MT Newswires.

(Market Chatter news is derived from conversations with market professionals globally. This information is believed to be from reliable sources but may include rumor and speculation. Accuracy is not guaranteed.)

data.title: Heba reporting strong income from property management FY 2024
data.description:
Heba is reporting strong income from property management for FY 2024. Income from property management was SEK 216m (271), well above the target of SEK 200m. Excluding commonhold apartment income in 2023, performance is on par with the company’s best years. The full-year effect of the sale in 2023 of properties that generated almost SEK 100m in rental income is now fully integrated.

The NOI margin FY increased to 72% as compared to 71% in 2023. The change in the value of properties for FY 2024 was SEK 37.9m (-1,084.5), corresponding an uptick of 0.3% (-6.9).

Heba’s full-year performance in 2024 is a sign of strength and shows that we are doing things right. We have outperformed our target for the year. We have a modern property portfolio in attractive locations and a strong financial position. We now have our sights set on the future and are continuing our efforts towards sustainable growth while meeting the needs for housing and community service properties, Patrik Emanuelsson, CEO Heba Fastighets AB.

Energy use had been reduced to a record-low 75 kWh/m2 by the end of the year. The work to reach the target of 40 kWh/m2 in 2030 is ongoing.

Key figures 1 October - 31 December 2024:

  • Profit for the period amounted to SEK 106.6m (-57.8), corresponding to SEK 0.65 (-0.35) per share.
  • Income from property management was SEK 46.9m (47.8). The decrease is related to poorer performance in jointly controlled entities and higher interest expenses due to higher interest-bearing liabilities.
  • Rental income amounted to SEK 143.8m (128.8).
  • Net operating income (NOI) was SEK 100.9m (86.9).
  • The change in the value of properties was SEK 70.5m (-80.7).
  • Heba took ownership in Q4 of an elderly care facility comprising 54 apartments in Enköping.

Key figures FY 2024:

  • Profit for the year amounted to SEK 98.7m (-712.3), corresponding to SEK 0.60 (-4.31) per share.
  • Income from property management was SEK 215.5m (270.7). The performance is on par with income from property management in 2023 excluding commonhold apartment income in jointly controlled entities.
  • Rental income amounted to SEK 561.8m (565.7).
  • Net operating income (NOI) was SEK 403.8m (402.1).
  • The change in the value of properties was SEK 37.9m (-1,084.5).
  • The board of directors proposes a dividend of SEK 0,52 (0.52) per share.
  • Heba took ownership in Q4 of an elderly care facility comprising 54 apartments in Enköping.

ETTEPLAN OYJ, Investor News, February 5, 2025, at 1.00 p.m.

Etteplan’s Financial Statement Release for 2024 to be published on February 12, 2025

Etteplan Oyj will publish its Financial Statement Release for 2024 on Wednesday February 12, 2025 at approximately 13.00 (EET). The release and related presentation material will be available in Finnish and in English on the Company’s website at www.etteplan.com after the publishing.

Conference call and live webcast

Etteplan’s President and CEO Juha Näkki will present the Company’s result for 2024 in a conference call and a live webcast, held in English language, on February 12, 2025 starting at 14.30 (EET).

Questions can be asked in Finnish and in English after President and CEO’s presentation only through conference call connection. Participants must register through this link https://palvelu.flik.fi/teleconference/?id=50051395 to ask questions through the conference call lines. After registering the participant will receive a teleconference number and a code to join the call. The participants are asked to press *5 to join the queue for questions.

Juha Näkki’s presentation can be followed as a live webcast on https://etteplan.events.inderes.com/q4-2024 . The webcast starts at 14.30 (EET). A recording of the webcast will be available later at www.etteplan.com.

Etteplan is a growing technology service company with the purpose of bringing people and technologies together to change things for the better. Our customers include world's leading companies in the manufacturing industry.

In 2023, we had a turnover of EUR 360.0 million and around 4,000 professionals in Finland, Sweden, the Netherlands, Germany, Poland, Denmark and China. Etteplan's shares are listed on Nasdaq Helsinki Ltd under the ETTE ticker. www.etteplan.com

data.title: UPM's Board of Directors has resolved to establish a new employee share savings arrangement and approved the commencement of new annual plans within UPM share incentive arrangements
data.description:
UPM-Kymmene Oyj

UPM-Kymmene Corporation Stock Exchange Release (Other information disclosed according to the rules of the Exchange)              5 February 2025 at 13:00 EET

UPM’s Board of Directors has resolved to establish a new employee share savings arrangement and approved the commencement of new annual plans within UPM share incentive arrangements

Employee Share Savings Arrangement

UPM’s Board of Directors has resolved to establish a new Employee Share Savings Arrangement and approved the commencement of the first plan 2025-2028 under the arrangement.

The Employee Share Savings Arrangement is targeted at employees of UPM-Kymmene Corporation and its subsidiaries in the countries where it is legally and administratively feasible.

The purpose of the arrangement is to engage company employees, increase their interest towards company performance and long-term value creation and to align the interests of employees and shareholders. 

The Employee Share Savings Arrangement consists of annually commencing plans, subject to the approval of the Board of Directors of UPM in each case, each one comprising of a 12-month savings period and a two-year holding period following the savings period. The employees will have an opportunity to save a proportion of their salaries and invest those savings in UPM shares. The savings will be used to acquire UPM shares from the market quarterly after the publication dates of the respective interim reports. As a reward UPM grants the participating employees a gross reward of one (1) matching share for each two (2) savings shares acquired with their savings. The delivery of the share reward is subject to the continuation of the employment or service and holding of acquired savings shares for the duration of the holding period. Additionally, each employee participating in the first commencing savings period will be rewarded ten (10) free gross shares after the 12-month savings period in July 2026, provided that the employee has not stopped their savings during the savings period and is employed the whole savings period. The applicable taxes will be deducted before the shares are delivered to the participants. Share delivery will be executed by using already existing shares and the arrangement, therefore, has no dilutive effect.

The first savings period is from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026. The holding period starts at the initial acquisition of savings shares and ends on 30 June 2028. The maximum monetary amount that all participants collectively may save during the savings period is EUR 22,0 million. The calculatory maximum number of matching shares (gross) and free shares (gross) for the first plan is approximately 478,100, calculated at the prevalent share price provided that the plan limit is met. The estimated maximum expense for the plan, based on UPM’s current share value, is EUR 15,5 million in total. The final number of matching shares depends on the employees’ participation and savings rate in the arrangement, and the fulfilment of the prerequisites for receiving matching shares, as well as the number of shares acquired from the market with savings. The final number of free shares depends on the employees’ participation and the fulfilment of the conditions for receiving free shares.

Deferred Bonus Arrangement

UPM’s Board of Directors has approved the commencement of a new plan for the period 2025–2027 within the company’s Deferred Bonus Arrangement.

The Deferred Bonus Arrangement consists of annually commencing new plans subject to the approval of the Board of Directors of UPM in each case.

The Deferred Bonus Arrangement is targeted at key employees of the Company.

The earning criteria for the Deferred Bonus Plan for the period 2025-2027 are based on the Group and each business area’s EBITDA. The plan for the period 2025–2027 consists of a one-year earning period (2025) and a two-year restriction period following thereafter (2026–2027).

The  Deferred Bonus Plan for the period 2025–2027 covers in total 317 participants. The maximum number of shares (gross) for the plan period in case all the set earning criteria are met in full is approximately 510,300 shares calculated at the prevalent share price. The estimated maximum cost for the plan period is EUR 14,3 million. The estimated maximum number of shares represents the gross value of the rewards of which the applicable taxes will be deducted before the shares are delivered to the participants.

Share delivery will be executed by using already existing shares and the plan, therefore, has no dilutive effect. Besides the attainment of the earning criteria the reward under the plan is subject to the continuation of the employment. The share rewards earned on the basis of the plan for the period 2025–2027 will be delivered in 2028.

Restricted Share Arrangement

UPM’s Board of Directors has approved the commencement of new plan for the period 2025–2028 within the company’s Restricted Share Arrangement.

The Restricted Share Arrangement consists of annually commencing new plans subject to the approval of the Board of Directors of UPM in each case.

The Restricted Share Arrangement is used as a commitment instrument for individually selected participants in specific recruitment and retention situations. The Restricted Share Arrangement is targeted at the President and CEO, Group Executive Team members and other selected members of the senior management. The President and CEO is not eligible to receive a reward from this Arrangement for retention purposes.

The plan for the period 2025-2028 consists of four consecutive years and is divided into the grant period and the vesting period. The grant period comprises the first year of each plan (2025) during which rewards can be granted to the participants. Vesting period comprises the three-year period following the end of a grant period (2026-2028) during which share rewards are delivered in instalments to the participants. The first instalment of the reward shall be delivered no earlier than one year after the date the participant was nominated to the plan.

The share rewards based on the plan 2025–2028 will be delivered to participants in annual instalments by the end of 2028. Share delivery will be executed by using already existing shares and, therefore, has no dilutive effect.

The maximum number of shares that may be granted under the Restricted Share Plan 2025–2028 is 500,000 shares (gross). The maximum number of shares represents the gross value of the rewards of which the applicable taxes will be deducted before the shares are delivered to the participants. No earning criteria is applied to the Restricted Share Arrangement and the delivery of the share reward is subject to the continuation of the employment or service.

In addition to the Restricted Share Arrangement UPM has also Performance Share Arrangement targeted at the President and CEO, Group Executive Team members and other selected members of the senior management. Share reward under this arrangement is subject to the achievement of predefined earning criteria.
